page.title: 06LOCAL GOVERNMENT-MARSHFIELD
page.content: Marshfield used to be in Gloucestershire but since 1974 has been in the County of Avon (though the postal address is Wiltshire!), and in the District of Northavon. Rates are high, being 189 1/2 pence per pound for domestic properties. It has its own Parish Council of nine members (Chairman,{John Kitley;}Clerk,{John} {Humphreys).} Meetings are held on alternate Tuesdays in the Tolzey Hall and are open to the public, though few attend, even for the Annual Meeting. Recent concerns have been over planning, conservation, car parking in the High Street and other traffic problems, the Plan for the Parish for the next decade and the Best Kept Village Competition. The Parish Council are also concerned with the new Community Centre Project.
